parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To direct my gaze, look steadily. From a compound of a and teino; to gaze intently.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
